summary:
Tokyo, the capital of Japan, is a massive metropolis with over 14 million residents. It's one of the world's most populous cities and serves as Japan's economic and political center. Originally a fishing village called Edo, it became the seat of power during the Tokugawa shogunate in 1603. After the Meiji Restoration, the capital was moved from Kyoto to Edo, which was renamed Tokyo. 

Today, Tokyo is home to many major companies, universities, and iconic landmarks like Tokyo Skytree. It has hosted major international events, including the Olympics, and is known for its efficient transport system, including the high-speed Shinkansen trains.
title: Tokyo
